Name: Is there a distinct category of dual for verbal agreement with a dual subject?
Is non-agreement in number between the nominal subject and verbal predicate possible?
Can finite verbs agree in number with the nominal object?
Can an adnominal property word agree with the noun in case?
Example:
пичиезтэк пиетэк [pit͡ɕi-jez-tek pi-je-tek];
small-DEF-ABE son-POSS.1SG-ABE;without my younger son;
Comment: It is possible with attributively used parts of speech with definite suffix (Аlatyrev1983: 588, Winkler 2001: 32).

Name: Are there cases that do not show agreement in terms of case?
Example: вуж коркан [vuʒ korkɑ-n];old house-INE;in an old house;

Name: Can adpositions be used to mark core verbal arguments?
Can adpositions be used to mark non-core/oblique verbal arguments?
Example: Кор вылын пуке пересь кышномурт [kor vɨlɨn puk-e pereɕ kɨʃnomurt];log on sit-PRS.3SG old woman;An old woman sits on a log;GSUJa 1962: 32

Name: Can non-finite clauses entail a special way for a core argument (S/A) marking?
Example:
Фаина солэсь умме усемзэ öз ни шöды [Fɑinɑ so-leɕ umm-e uɕ-em-ze ɘ-z ɲi ʃɘdɨ];
Faina she-ABL dream-INE drop-PTCP-ACC.3SG NEG.PST-3SG already feel.CNG.SG;Faina didn't feel any more that/how she [Tamara] fell asleep;Еdygarova 2010: 124

Name: Can non-finite clauses entail a special way for a core argument (P) marking?
Do characteristics of object referent (topicality, animacy, definiteness) influence object marking?
Example: мон ӝук/ӝук-ез сии [mon d͡ʒuk/d͡ʒuk-ez ɕi-i];I porridge[ACC]/-ACC eat-PST.1SG;I have eaten (the) porridge;Winkler 2001: 20;|мон пуныез/чебер корка адӟи [mon punɨ-jez/t͡ɕeber korkɑ ɑd͡d͡ʑ-i];I dog-ACC/nice house[ACC] see-PST.1SG;I saw a dog/a nice house;Winkler 2001: 21

Name: Does object marking correlate with aspectuality?
Does the marking of the object depend on the verb conjugation form?
Is there differential subject marking?
Can S and A be conflated morphologically across clause boundaries, i.e. act as syntactic pivot?
Example: Пи нылэз чупаз но бызьыса кошкиз [pi nɨl-ez t͡ɕup-ɑz no  bɨʑɨ-sɑ koʃk-iz];boy girl-ACC kiss-PST.3SG and Ø run-CVB go.away-PST.3SG;The boy kissed the girl and ran away;

Name: Can S and P be conflated morphologically across clause boundaries, i.e. act as syntactic pivot?
Is there a grammatical device for habituality?
Example: Гуртын улыкуз, ата-е нюлэскы ветлы-л-о-з вал [gurt-ɨn ulɨ-ku-z ataj-e ɲulesk-ɨ vetlɨ-l-o-z val];country-INE live-CVB-POSS.3SG father-POSS.1SG forest-ILL go-FRQ-FUT-3SG AUX;When my father lived in the country he used to go to the forest;

Name: Is there a grammatical device for frequentative?
Example: юалля- [juɑ-ʎʎɑ-];ask-FRQ;to ask repeatedly;

Name: Is there a grammatical device for progressivity?
Example: Ана-е вуы-ку мон сиськ-исько вал [anaj-e vuɨ-ku mon ɕiɕk-iɕko val];mother-POSS.1SG come-CVB I eat-PRS.1SG AUX;When my mother came, I was eating.'

Name: Is it common to use a verb in the present tense for future time reference?
Example: Кошкисько мон [koʃk-iɕko mon];leave-PRS.1SG I;I'm leaving;
Comment: The present tense may be used for the expression of an action in the near future (GSUJa 1962: 200, Winkler 2001: 46-47).

Name: Is there a grammatical device for immediate future?
Is there a grammatical device for pluperfect?
Example: Ми лыктыку со кошкемын ни вал [mi lɨktɨ-ku so koʃk-emɨn ɲi vɑl];we come-CVB s/he leave-PASS already AUX;S/he had already left before we arrived;

Name: Can aspect be expressed overtly on the negative marker?
Can tense be expressed overtly on the negative marker?
Example: Уг ужа [u-g uʒɑ];NEG.PRS-3SG work.CNG.3SG;S/he does not work;|Öз ужа [ɘ-z uʒɑ];NEG.PST-3SG work.CNG.SG;S/he did not work;|Со ужа-м [so uʒa-m];;S/he worked, apparently;|Со ужа-мтэ [so uʒa-mte];;s/he didn't work, apparently;

Name: Is there grammatical marking of mirativity?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of desire or wish?
Is there morphological marking for irrealis (e.g. hypothetical state of affairs)?
Example: Быгатысал ке, гуртын улысал [bɨgɑtɨ-sɑl ke, gurt-ɨn ulɨ-sɑl];can-COND if village-INE live-COND;I would live in the countryside if I could;

Name: Are verbs marked in a specific mood in counterfactual conditional clauses?
Example: Бискыли пыжысал ке, сиысал сое [biskɨʎi pɨʒɨ-sɑl ke, ɕiɨ-sɑl so-je];cake[ACC] bake-COND if eat-COND it-ACC;If I baked a cake, I would eat it;

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of deontic necessity?
Example: Мыным гуртэ мыноно [mɨnɨm gurt-e mɨn-ono];I.DAT house-ILL go-PTCP;I must go home;Winkler 2001: 58

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of epistemic possibility?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of deontic possibility?
Is there morphological marking on the verb used to express indirect commands/wishes etc. directed to the 3Sg?
Is there morphological marking on the verb used to express indirect commands/wishes etc. directed to the 1Sg?
Example: Со вераз мар мон каром [so vera-z mar mon kar-om];s/he say-PST.3SG what I do-OPT.1SG;S/she told what I should do;

Name: Is it common to use the imperative/jussive in complement clauses introduced by predicates expressing wish/desire/will?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of apprehension?
Is there reflexive conjugation?
Are there syntactically ditransitive verbs?
Can non-singular 2nd and 3rd person have the same person/number marking or morphosyntactic treatment?
Example: мынӥллям(ды) [mɨni-ʎʎɑ-m(-dɨ)];go-FRQ-2PST(POSS.2PL);;|мынӥллям(зы) [mɨni-ʎʎɑ-m(-zɨ)];go-FRQ-2PST(POSS.3PL);Winkler 2001: 50

Name: Can an impersonal (or passive) form be used instead of a finite plural form with an overt subject expression?
Example: Куноос ву-эмын [kuno-os vu-emɨn];guest-PL arive-PASS;Guests arrived;

Name: Can third person plural verb forms be used for impersonal reference?
Example: Шыдэз пуньыен сиё [ʃɨd-ez puɲɨ-jen ɕij-o];soup-ACC spoon-INS eat-PRS.3PL;Soup is eaten with a spoon;

Name: Can second person singular verb forms be used in generic meaning?
Example: Маке кизид, сое ик аралод [mɑke kiʑ-i-d, so-je ik ɑrɑ-lo-d];what sow-PST-2SG that-ACC reap-FUT-2SG;What you sow, then you will reap;

Name: Are clauses with only infinitive predicates possible?
Can verbs in purposive subordinate clauses be in bare infinitive form?
Example: Мон мынӥсько Венгрие мадьяр кылэз дышетыны [mon mɨn-iɕko vengri-je mɑɟjɑr kɨl-ez dɨʃet-ɨnɨ];I go-PRS.1SG Hungary-ILL hungarian language-ACC study-INF;I’m going to Hungary in order to study Hungarian;

Name: Are there sentences without overt verbal arguments (e.g. weather verbs)?
Example: зорэ [zor-e];rain-PRS.3SG;It is raining;

Name: Is copula needed for predicate nominals in the 3rd person form of the present tense?
Is a copula needed for predicate nominals in the past and/or future tense?
Example: Мон дышетӥсь вал/луо [mon dɨʃet-ɨɕ vɑl/lu-o];I teach-NMLZ be.PST/be-FUT.1SG;I was/will be a teacher;

Name: Can locative adverbial phrases act as predicates without a copula?
Example: Мон гуртын [mon gurt-ɨn];I home-INE;I am at home;

Name: Can the same coordinating conjunction be used for NPs, VPs, and clauses?
Does existential negation have a separate operator?
Example: Мон öвöл шузи [me ɘvɘl ʃuʑi];I NEG stupid;I am not stupid;

Name: Can standard negation be asymmetric in the present tense?
Example: мон ужасько : мон уг ужаськы [mon uʒɑ-ɕko : mon u-g uʒɑ-ɕk-ɨ];I work-PRS.1SG  :  I NEG.PRS-1SG work-PRS-NEG.SG;I work’ : ‘I don’t work;

Name: Can non-finite dependent clauses use the standard negation construction?
Is there a special negator that combines with non-finite forms?
Example: лыдӟымтэ книга [lɨd͡d͡ʑɨ-mte kɲigɑ];read-PTCP.NEG book;unread book;|дыртытэк лыдӟе [dɨrtɨ-tek lɨd͡d͡ʑ-e];hurry-CVB.NEG read-PRS.3SG;S/he is reading without hurry;Winkler 2001: 59

Name: Are there special negative non-finite forms?
Example: дыртытэк лыдӟе [dɨrtɨ-tek lɨd͡d͡ʑ-e];hurry-CVB.NEG read-PRS.3SG;S/he is reading without hurry;Winkler 2001: 59

Name: Is there an impersonal passive construction?
Are there nonfinite forms specialized on the relativization of particular core participants, e.g. subjects (S/A), direct objects (P), absolutive participants (S/P)?
Example: гожъяськись пи [goʒjɑɕk-ɨɕ pi];write-PTCP boy;writing boy;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can relativize at least all core participants (S/A/P) and possibly also some noncore participants, e.g. locative adverbials, instruments, etc.?
Are there nonfinite forms that can relativize at least some noncore participants, e.g. locative adverbials or instruments, but cannot relativize all or some of the core participants, e.g. subjects?
Example: val-ez š’už’ja-n sǝ̑na-n-z-e Vaš’a ǝ̑st-i-z;horse-ACC clean-PTCP comb-3-ACC Vasya lose-PST-3;Vasya lost the comb with which he used to clean the horse;

Name: Is there a specialized negative participial form, which cannot be analyzed as a specific participial marker + negation marker?
Example: лыдӟымтэ книга [lɨd͡d͡ʑɨ-mte kɲigɑ];read-PTCP.NEG book;unread book;Winkler 2001: 59

Name: Is there a future participle?
Example: лыдӟоно книга [lɨd͡d͡ʑ-ono kɲigɑ];read-PTCP book;the book which must be read;Winkler 2001: 58

Name: Are there participles that can encode their subject by possessive suffixes?
Example: гуртэ мыноное [gurt-e mɨn-ono-e];home-ILL go-PTCP-POSS.1SG;I must go home;Winkler 2001: 58

Name: Can subject in at least some participial subordinate clauses be encoded in the same way as in independent clauses?
Are there participles that obligatorily agree with the nouns they modify in case and number (in all contexts)?
Example: Киземаз бусыын [kiʑ-em-az busɨ-ɨn];sow-PTCP-DEF.INE field-INE;in the sowed field;
Comment: In the cases of attributively used parts of speech with definite suffix.

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and action nominalizations?
Example: кулэм вал [kul-em vɑl];die-PTCP horse;dead horse;|kul-em;;death;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and agentive nominalizations?
Example: ужась адями [uʒɑ-ɕ ɑɟɑmi];work-PTCP person;working person;|uʒɑ-ɕ;work-NMLZ;worker;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and converbs without any additional morphological material, such as case markers?
Example: вала-мон уж [vala-mon už];understand-PTCP work;comprehesible work;|валамон вераськиз [vɑlɑ-mon verɑ-ɕki-z];understand-GER speak-PST-3SG;S/he spoke comprehensibly;

Name: Is OV the neutral order in affirmative imperative clauses?
Example: чай ю! [t͡ɕɑj ju];tea[ACC] drink.IMP.2SG;drink tea;

Name: Is it possible to place an object between the negative marker and the main verb in imperative constructions?
Are there preverbs?
Are there verbal prefixes?
Is there diminutive (hypocoristic) marking on verbs?
Can modifiers of action nominalization in agent and patient roles both be marked like possessors?
Can the modifier of action nominalization in patient role (e.g. "drinking of coffee") be marked like the direct object?
Example: нылпиосты дышетон [nɨlpi-os-tɨ dɨʃet-on];child-PL-ACC teach-NMLZ;teaching of children;|Мон нылпиосты дышетӥсько [mon nɨlpi-os-tɨ dɨʃet-iɕko];I child-PL-ACC teach-PRS.1SG;I teach children;

Name: Do core adjectives agree with the subject noun in number in the predicative position?
Example: Гуртъёс бадӟымесь [gurt-jos bɑd͡d͡ʑɨm-eɕ];village-PL large-PL;The villages are large;Winkler 2001: 40

Name: Is it possible to form synthetic superlative?
Can adpositions have person/number marking?
Example: азяд [ɑʑ-ɑd];front-POSS.2SG.INE/ILL;in front of you;

Name: Are there separate adpositions to express goal, source, and location (without there being syncretism)?
Example: корка улэ [korkɑ ul-e];house underside-ILL;(to) under the house;|корка улын [korkɑ ul-ɨn];house underside-INE;under the house;|корка улысь [korkɑ ul-ɨɕ];house underside-ELA;from under the house;

Name: Is case compounding possible?
Example: гуртлэнэзлэн [gurt-len-ez-len];village-GEN-POSS.3SG-GEN;of the one that belongs to the village;Arkhangelskij & Usacheva 2018: 112

Name: Are there case categories only found in pronouns?
Does the numeral modification of a noun have an effect on its case selection?
Is the singular form of the noun also used with numerals bigger than 1?
Example: одӥг книга : куинь книга [odig kɲigɑ : kuiɲ kɲigɑ];one book.NOM.SG :  three book.NOM.SG;one book : three books;

Name: Is there a genitive case that has an affix?
Example: солэн пиез [so-len pi-jez];s/he-GEN son-POSS.3SG;his/her son;

Name: Is there a dative case used to express indirect object/receiver/goal (different from a local case)?
Example: Cёт мыным кыл! [ɕot mɨnɨm kɨl!];give.IMP.2SG I.DAT word[ACC];Give me the word!;

Name: Is there a terminative case?
Example: шурозь [ʃur-oʑ];river-TERM;to the river;

Name: Is there a separate case to indicate without what/who an action takes place / does not take place?
Example: Пиналъёстэк улон туж мöзмыт [pinɑl-jos-tek ulon tuʒ mɘzmɨt];child-PL-ABE life very sad;Life without children is very sad;Winkler 2001: 24

Name: Is there a separate case to mark the motion along or by the referent of the noun (prolative)?
Example: Мон ӧсэтӥ потӥсько [mon ɘs-eti pot-iɕко];I door-PROL exit-PRS.1SG;I’ll go out through the door;Kel'makov 2008

Name: Is there a locative case that marks goal?
Example: гуртэ [gurt-e];village-ILL;to a village;

Name: Is there a locative case that marks location?
Example: гуртын [gurt-ɨn];village-INE;in a village;

Name: Is there a locative case that marks source?
Example: гуртысь [gurt-ɨɕ];village-ELA;from a village;

Name: Is there case syncretism of goal and location marking?
Example: гуртаз [gurt-ɑz];village-ILL/INE.POSS.3SG;into his/her village / in his/her village;
Comment: There is syncretism in the possessive declension.

Name: Is there case syncretism of location and source marking?
Are there two sets of local cases?
Is there a third set of local cases?
Is there a separate case for marking the means by which something is carried out (instrumental) and/or accompaniement (comitative)?
Example: пуньы-ен [puɲɨ-jen];spoon-INS;with spoon;|ана-ен [anaj-en];mother-INS;with mother;

Name: Is there a separate case for marking accompaniment, which is different from the instrumental?
Is there a separate case for marking the result of change (translative) and/or a state of being (essive)?
Is there a separate case for marking the state of being (essive), which is different from the translative?
Is there a separate morphological marker for expressing equative meaning?
Is there an inflectional nominal marker for expressing benefactive or destinative semantics independent from the dative?
Is there in addition to the basic declension a declension different from a possessive declension?
Is it possible to use singular with paired body parts/clothing/accessories that accompany them?
Example: син [ɕin];eye[NOM.SG];eyes;

Name: Can the marking of the possessor in the attributive construction vary?
Example: солэн пиез [so-len pi-jez];s/he-GEN son-POSS.3SG;his/her son;|солэсь пизэ [so-leɕ pi-ze];s/he-ABL son-ACC.POSS.3SG;his/her son;

Name: Can the possessor in the attributive construction be marked with the nominative?
Example: скал йыр;cow.NOM head;cow's head;

Name: Is non-singular possession marked in the possessive declension?
Example: книга-ед [kniga-jed];book-POSS.2SG;your book;|книга-ос-ыд [kniga-os-d];book-PL-POSS.2SG;your books;
Comment: When the possessor is singular, there are two sets of PX for singular and plural possessee.

Name: Can 2Sg possessive suffix be used to mark definiteness?
Example: Шундыед но ӝужа ни [ʃundɨ-jed no d͡ʒuʒ-ɑ ɲi]; sun-POSS.2SG uprise-PRS.3SG already;The sun is already uprising;Kеl'makov 2000: 24

Name: Can 3Sg possessive suffix be used to mark definiteness?
Example: Отын вуэз туж чылкыт [otɨn vu-ez tuʒ t͡ɕɨlkɨt];there water-POSS.3SG very clear;The water is very clear there;Kеl'makov 2000: 24

Name: Is there animacy distinction in independent interrogative pronouns?
Example: Кин та? [kin tɑ?];who this;Who is it?;|Мар та? [mɑr tɑ?];what this;What is it?;

Name: When used as a relative pronoun, is it common to use 'who' for animates other than humans?
Comment: A separate relative pronoun is used, e.g. соиз писей, кудӥз… [soiz piɕej, kudiz] 'that cat which…'.

Name: When used as a relative pronoun, is it common to use 'who' for inanimates?
Comment:
A separate relative pronoun is used, e.g. Тынад вань книгаед, кудӥз мыным кулэ [
tɨnɑd vɑɲ kɲigɑ-jed, kudiz mɨnɨm kul-e] (you.GEN EX book-POSS.2SG which I.DAT be.needed-PRS.3SG) 'You have a book, what I need'.

Name: Can a demonstrative stem be used in the function of a pronoun with 3rd person singular human referent?
Example: сo so;; he/she’;|соиз писпу [soiz pispu];;that tree;|таиз писпу [tɑiz pispu];;this tree;|Таиз номыре но уг тоды [tɑiz nomɨr-e no u-g todɨ];this nothing-ACC NEG.PRS-3SG know.CNG.SG;This knows nothing;

Name: Is the order of possessive suffix and case suffix across the paradigm the same?
Is the order of number and case suffixes fixed across the paradigm the same?
Example: пиослы [pi-os-lɨ];boy-PL-DAT;to the boys;

Name: Are there different words for mother’s brother and father’s brother?
Example:
ӵужмурт [t͡ɕoʒmurt];;mother's brother;|
агай [agaj];;father's brother;

Name: Are there different words for younger and older relative for other relations than siblings?
Is there animacy distinction for both concepts 'new/young' and 'old'?
Example: егит [jegit] – пересь [pereɕ];;young – old (animate);|выль [vɨʎ] – вуж [vuʒ];;new – old (inanimate);

Name: Is there distinction for both 'warm' and 'cold' based on whether referring to weather or to temperature of objects?
Is there contrastive length of consonants?
Is there contrastive length of vowels?
Is there contrast between short and long unstressed vowels?
Is there contrast in duration of geminate consonants?
Are there more than two phonological quantities?
Are there extralong syllables?
Is the main foot structure trochaic?
Is there lexically distinctive word stress?
Is there morphologically conditioned stress?
Example: нокин [nokin] 'nobody'

Name: Is there fixed primary stress?
Is there stress in heavy syllables?
Is there non-initial primary stress?
Example: верасько [veraɕko] 'I say'

Name: Is there palatal vowel harmony?
Is there velar vowel harmony?
Is there labial vowel harmony?
Are there rising diphthongs?
Are there lowering diphthongs?
Example: куар [kuar] 'leaf'

Name: Is there qualitative contrast between subsets of short and long vowels?
Are there full vs. reduced vowels as contrastive subsets?
Is there front high rounded vowel ü [y]?
Is there front midhigh rounded vowel ö [ø]?
Is there back high unrounded vowel ï [ɯ]?
Example: лы [lɨ] 'bone'

Name: Is there back midhigh unrounded vowel ë [ɤ]?
Is there back low round vowel [ɒ]?
Is there contrast between low and mid front vowels (ä [æ] vs. e [e])?
Are there word-initial consonant clusters?
Example: скал [skal] 'cow'

Name: Are there word-internal consonant clusters in syllable onset?
Are there consonant clusters in syllable coda?
Example: пурт purt 'knife'

Name: Are there clusters of three or more consonants in a word between vowels?
Are there word-final clusters of three or more consonants?
Are there palatalized dentals?
Are there palatalized labials and velars?
Is there palatal stop [c]?
Example: вить [vic] 'five'

Name: Is there palatal nasal [ɲ]?
Example: нянь [ɲɑɲ] 'bread'

Name: Is there palatal lateral [ʎ]?
Example: выль [vɨʎ] 'new'

Name: Is there phonemic velar nasal [ŋ]?
Is there dental affricate [t͡s]?
Example: ӵуж  [t͡suž] 'yellow'

Name: Is there non-alveolar affricate (e.g. [t͡ʃ], [͡cɕ])?
Example: чебер [t͡ʃeber] 'beautiful'

Name: Is there a phonological contrast between [s] and postalveolar sibilant [ʃ]?
Example: шур [ʃur] 'river'

Name: Are there voiced plosives [b, g, d]?
Example: губи [gubi] 'mushroom'

Name: Is there glottal stop [ˀ]?
Is there phonological contrast between plain and labial velar consonants (e.g. [k] vs. [kʷ])?
Is there a constraint on word-initial r?
Example: ӟуч [d͡ʑut͡ɕ] ‘Russian’

Name: Is there laryngeal fricative [h]?
Is there voiced velar fricative [ɣ]?
Comment: Only in new loanwords, e.g. вахта [vɑхtɑ] 'watch'.

Name: Is there voiceless velar fricative [x]?
Is there voiced dental fricative [ð]?
Is there phonemic labio-velar approximant [w]?
Is there voiceless labiodental fricative [f]?
Is there radical qualitative consonant gradation?
Is there quantitative consonant gradation?
